Krishansar Lake14. Brari Nambal Lake15. Tulian LakeFrequently Asked Questions About Lakes In KashmirJoin our travel community for the latest tips, guides, and exclusive offers!Subscribe You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Welcome to the land of magnificent beauty, where serenity meets magnificence and dreams come true! If you’re considering a trip, the Kashmir tour packages provide an unforgettable experience, especially if you enjoy the beauty of nature. The gorgeous lakes are some of the best places to visit in Kashmir. Yes, the lakes in Kashmir are more than just bodies of water; they are like artists’ works come to life, each with its own unique allure.These serene lakes are not only a visual treat but also a spiritual delight. Imagine gliding through the lake in a traditional Shikara, admiring the magnificent Himalayas reflected in the beautiful waters. Lakes in Kashmir provide all of this and much more. Whether you’re looking for adventure or a relaxing getaway, the diversity of things to do in Kashmir will amaze you. There’s something for everyone, from fishing to trekking, from picnics to simply taking in the breathtaking sights.So, why wait? Dive into this blog to explore the magical lakes in Kashmir, discover hidden gems, and prepare to make memories that will last a lifetime!15 Best Lakes In Kashmir1. Dal Lake2. Nigeen Lake3. Gadsar Lake4. Wular Lake5. Manasbal Lake6. Tso Moriri Lake7. Tsokar Lake8. Pangong Lake9. Gangabal Lake10. Sheshnag Lake11. Kausar Nag Lake12. Vishansar Lake13. Krishansar Lake14. Brari Nambal Lake15. Tulian Lake1. Dal LakeImage Source : ThetimesofIndia”Dal Lake, a shining jewel among lakes in Kashmir, is more than simply a gorgeous body of water; it’s an experience ready to embrace you. Consider yourself on board one of the traditional houseboats in Kashmir, drifting softly on the mirror-like surface of Dal Lake. But Dal Lake has far more to offer. What about shopping in Kashmir on the water? Yes, sellers row up to your houseboat on this beautiful lake, offering vivid local handicrafts, fresh flowers, and unusual spices. You can go shopping without ever leaving your floating home!The lakes in Kashmir, particularly Dal Lake, are a universe unto themselves, offering uncommon and exquisite delights. A journey to Dal Lake immerses you in the enchantment and culture of Kashmir, producing memories you’ll cherish for the rest of your life.Why To VisitStay in a Houseboat: Experience traditional living on the water.Shopping: Buy unique gifts and souvenirs directly on the lake.Scenic Beauty: Witness breathtaking landscapes, especially during sunrise and sunset.Cultural Experience: Enjoy the local cuisine and explore the traditional Kashmiri lifestyle.Best Time To Visit: April To October2. Nigeen LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Nigeen Lake, a pearl among the stunning lakes in Kashmir, is a must-see destination. This lake near Srinagar is famous for its crystal clear waters and bright houseboats. Its name translates as “The Jewel in the Ring,” and it more than lives up to this beautiful description. It’s an ideal location for experiencing the allure of summer in Kashmir.Why To VisitScenic Beauty: One of the most beautiful lakes in Kashmir, Nigeen Lake’s picturesque surroundings are mesmerizing.Houseboat Experience: Stay in a traditional houseboat and experience life on the lake.Kashmiri Food: Relish authentic Kashmiri food while enjoying the view.Water Activities: Engage in exciting water sports like water skiing and boating.Best Time To Visit: May To November3. Gadsar LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Gadsar Lake, nestled among the breathtaking valleys in Kashmir, is a hidden gem that symbolizes natural beauty. It’s often referred to as the “Lake of Flowers,” and it’s without a doubt one of the most gorgeous lakes in Kashmir. This lake, surrounded by snow-capped mountains and vivid wildflowers, is ideal for environment lovers and tranquillity seekers.Why To VisitPicturesque Beauty: As part of the beautiful lakes in Kashmir, its scenic panorama will captivate your soul.Adventure Trails: For trekkers and hikers, the routes leading to Gadsar Lake offer a thrilling experience.Flora and Fauna: Witness the unique species of flowers, butterflies, and birds that thrive in this region.Peaceful Retreat: Escape the hustle and bustle of city life and bask in the tranquillity.Best Time To Visit:  May To September 4. Wular LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Wular Lake, one of Asia’s largest freshwater lakes, is a fascinating treasure among lakes in Kashmir. It’s a sight to behold, nestled among lush mountains and bright scenery, and a nature lover’s heaven. It’s glittering waters and tranquil ambience makes it one of Kashmir’s most sought-after lakes. A visit to Wular Lake is like entering a peaceful universe.Why To VisitScenic Beauty: The panoramic views are awe-inspiring.Bird Watching: Home to various migratory birds.Boating: Experience a peaceful ride on its calm waters.Fishing: Enjoy a unique angling experience.Best Time To Visit: April to October 5. Manasbal LakeImage Source : Tripadvisor”Manasbal Lake, nestled among the gorgeous Himalayas, stands out as one of the most clean and enchanting lakes in Kashmir. The lake, with its crystal blue waters and surrounding foliage, is a vision of nature at its best. Every ripple in its calm waters tells a story, and every cold breeze sings a lullaby of peace and quiet.Why To VisitUnparalleled Beauty: Witness its captivating beauty, which is a visual treat for nature lovers.Boat Rides: Experience the serene boat rides that promise a journey of reflection and wonder.Bird Spotting: Spot the myriad of bird species that make it a birdwatcher’s paradise.Peace: Bask in the peaceful ambience, far from the maddening crowd.Best Time To Visit: April To October6. Tso Moriri LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Tso Moriri Lake, located in the isolated region of Ladakh, is one of Kashmir’s most beautiful lakes. It’s an undiscovered jewel where the sky meets the water and the horizon looks boundless. It’s a site that captivates the imagination, with its crystal clear waters reflecting the gorgeous mountains and brilliant blue sky. Tso Moriri, one of the best lakes in Kashmir, provides an unforgettable experience that speaks to the heart.Why To VisitStunning Scenery: With the lake’s sparkling blue waters and the backdrop of snow-capped mountains, Tso Moriri presents a panorama that’s beyond picturesque.Wildlife Exploration: It’s a haven for birdwatchers, where rare migratory birds can be spotted.Tranquil Environment: Far away from the hustle and bustle, this lake offers a peaceful retreat for those seeking solace.Cultural Experience: Visiting nearby villages will give you a glimpse of the rich culture and traditional lifestyle of the locals.Best Time To Visit: May To September7. Tsokar LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Tucked away in the mesmerizing region of Ladakh, Tsokar Lake is one of the hidden jewels among the lakes in Jammu and Kashmir. Often overshadowed by more famous counterparts, this beautiful saltwater lake has its own unique charm. Glistening like a pearl, Tsokar Lake is not just a destination but an experience waiting to be embraced.Come and explore Tsokar Lake, a less-travelled but awe-inspiring part of the lakes in Jammu and Kashmir. Its silence speaks volumes, and its landscape will leave you spellbound. It’s not just a destination but a soothing touch to your soul, waiting to be felt and cherished.Why To VisitUnparalleled Beauty: The pristine surroundings and majestic mountains create a panorama that’s nothing short of a painter’s fantasy.Bird Watching: Home to a variety of migratory birds, it’s a paradise for bird enthusiasts.Tranquil Retreat: Far from the hustle and bustle, it offers peace like nowhere else.Cultural Experience: The nearby nomadic settlements give you a glimpse into the local way of life.Best Time To Visit: May To September8. Pangong LakeImage Source : Tripadvisor”Pangong Lake is undoubtedly one of the most famous lakes in Kashmir, attracting travellers from all over the world. Located at a breathtaking altitude, this mesmerizing lake changes colours from azure to light blue to green and even grey, depending on the time of the day. Surrounded by rugged mountains and embraced by pristine beauty, it has become a symbol of the enchanting appeal that the famous lakes in Kashmir are known for. A visit to Pangong Lake promises an experience unlike any other.Why To VisitScenic Beauty: The picturesque landscape with crystal-clear waters offers a visual treat that’s unmatched.Bird Watching: A haven for bird enthusiasts, migratory birds are often spotted here.Nearby Wildlife Sanctuaries: Explore nearby wildlife sanctuaries in Kashmir and get acquainted with the unique fauna of the region.Photography: An absolute delight for photographers, capturing the lake’s various shades and the surrounding beauty.Best Time To Visit: May to September9. Gangabal LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Nestled at the foothills of the mighty Harmukh Mountain, Gangabal Lake is one of the most famous lakes in Kashmir. A jewel in the crown of this beautiful region, this alpine lake offers stunning panoramas that can leave anyone mesmerised. Its shimmering blue waters are surrounded by lush meadows and towering snow-capped peaks, making it an irresistible destination for nature enthusiasts and trekkers. Gangabal Lake isn’t just a sight to behold; it’s an experience waiting to be embraced.Why To VisitSpiritual Significance: Revered as a sacred place, it’s a spot for peace and spirituality.Trekking Paradise: For adventure lovers, the trek to Gangabal Lake offers breathtaking views.Fishing Experience: The lake is teeming with trout, making it a popular spot for angling.Photographer’s Dream: With its majestic landscape, it’s an ideal location for capturing nature’s grandeur.Best Time To Visit: June to September10. Sheshnag LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Sheshnag Lake, one of the most beautiful lakes in Kashmir, is a sight that will take your breath away. It’s a gem that mirrors the heavens, nestled among the lush green meadows and shielded by snow-capped peaks. This lake, named after a mythical serpent named Sheshnag, is said to have mystical properties and is steeped in history and lore. Sheshnag Lake’s unusual shape, quiet climate, and picturesque surroundings make it an unmissable attraction.Why To VisitSpiritual Experience: Many pilgrims and spiritual seekers visit Sheshnag Lake, drawing inspiration from its sacred importance in various mythologies.Stunning Views: The surreal landscapes surrounding the lake offer breathtaking photographic opportunities.Adventure Opportunities: Trekking and camping near the lake provide an adventurous edge to the otherwise calm surroundings.Unplugged Relaxation: A visit to Sheshnag Lake is a perfect way to disconnect from the bustle of daily life and embrace serenity.Best Time To Visit: June to September11. Kausar Nag LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Kausar Nag Lake, nestled in the magnificent mountains, is one of Kashmir’s lesser-known yet extremely spectacular lakes. This freshwater lake is shrouded in mythology and folklore and stands at an elevation that provides breathtaking views of the surrounding environment. The clear waters reflect the sky, producing a sight right out of a fairytale. If you’re an explorer at heart looking for a peaceful retreat away from the crowds, Kausar Nag Lake is waiting to enchant you with its unspoiled beauty.Why To VisitSerenity and Solitude: Escape the hustle and bustle and lose yourself in the peaceful embrace of nature.Trekking Adventure: For those looking to add a dash of adventure, the trek to Kausar Nag is as thrilling as it is rewarding.Spiritual Connection: Known for its sacred significance, this lake offers a profound spiritual experience.Photography Paradise: Capture the breathtaking panoramas; every frame here is a masterpiece.Best Time To Visit: June to September12. Vishansar LakeImage Source : Tripadvisor”Nestled among scenic meadows and towering mountains, Vishansar Lake is one of the hidden treasures among the lakes in Kashmir. Often termed as the ‘Lake of Vishnu’, it’s a place where serenity is served on a grand scale and nature puts on a show that is simply unparalleled.Why To VisitPicturesque Beauty: The pristine waters reflect the azure skies and lush greenery around them, making it a photographer’s paradise.Tranquil Environment: Away from the hustle and bustle, it’s a perfect spot for meditation and introspection.Trekker’s Delight: The journey to Vishansar Lake offers trekkers an adventurous path filled with scenic surprises.Rich Ecosystem: The lake is home to several species of fish, and if you’re lucky, you might even spot a flock of migratory birds.Best Time To Visit: June to September 13. Krishansar LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Krishansar Lake is one of Kashmir’s most enchanting lakes, situated in the magnificent mountains. The surrounding verdant meadows and crystal-clear water create a serene retreat for nature enthusiasts.It’s a place where peace meets breathtaking beauty, where one may reconnect with nature and escape the rush and bustle of daily life. Krishansar Lake is like a poetic masterpiece in which every sight sings a relaxing song.Why To VisitUntouched Beauty: Far from the bustling tourist spots, Krishansar offers an untouched slice of nature’s splendour.Fishing: The lake is abundant with trout, making it an angler’s paradise.Trekking: Engage in a mesmerizing trekking experience amidst the pristine surroundings.Flora and Fauna: Witness unique species of flowers and birds, making it a haven for nature lovers.Best Time To Visit: June and September14. Brari Nambal LakeImage Source : Greaterkashmir”Nestled in the heart of the valley, Gil Sar Lake is one of the hidden jewels among the lakes in Kashmir. With its serene blue waters and the mountains’ embracing shadows, it offers a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. A visit to this breathtaking lake is like stepping into a painting, where nature’s beauty unfolds in its purest form. Gil Sar Lake is not just a place; it’s an experience that resonates with the soul.Why To VisitNatural Beauty: The scenic surroundings and crystal clear water captivate all who visit.Peace and Tranquility: A perfect spot for meditation or simply enjoying a calm afternoon.Adventure Opportunities: From boating to fishing, the lake offers numerous outdoor activities.Cultural Connection: The local community’s hospitality adds to the charm, giving a glimpse into the rich Kashmiri culture.Best Time To Visit: April To October15. Tulian LakeImage Source : Wikipedia”Amidst the snow-clad peaks and velvet-green meadows of the Himalayas lies Tulian Lake, one of the most mesmerizing lakes in Kashmir. As if painted by the heavens, its pristine blue waters reflect the surrounding mountains, creating an otherworldly panorama. A visit here is like stepping into a dream, where nature unfurls its raw beauty with every glance.Why To VisitUntouched Beauty: Unlike many touristy spots, Tulian Lake offers a serene ambiance, untouched by the hustle and bustle.Panoramic Views: The lake provides breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks, making it a photographer’s paradise.Trekking Adventure: The trail to Tulian Lake promises an exhilarating trekking experience for adventure enthusiasts.Soulful Solitude: It’s a perfect place for soul-searchers looking for a peaceful escape.Best Time To Visit: May to August The lakes in Kashmir are more than just bodies of water; they are a blend of mystique, beauty, and nature’s poetry. Each lake, be it the world-renowned Dal Lake or the tranquil Tulian Lake, has its own charm and a story to tell.A trip to these heavenly abodes offers an escape from the mundane and a plunge into serenity. Whether you’re an adventure seeker, a photographer, or someone in search of peace, the lakes of Kashmir call out to your soul, promising an experience that’s as enchanting as the sparkling waters themselves.Come, let’s explore and get lost in their magic!Get exclusive travel insights & updates into your inbox!Subscribe *By clicking subscribe you'll receive emails from WanderOn.You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Shrutika Parab★★★★★24 May 2024“Thank you Team Wanderon for the amazing Ladakh Experience. What are the most famous lakes to visit in Kashmir?The most famous lakes to visit in Kashmir include Dal Lake, known for its houseboats, Nigeen Lake for its serenity; Pangong Lake for its breathtaking beauty; and Wular Lake, one of Asia’s largest freshwater lakes. Each offers unique beauty and captivating experiences.022. How can I explore the lakes in Kashmir?033. Are the lakes in Kashmir safe for tourists to visit?044.
